cheadline: 特朗普：柯克是保守主义的“殉道者”
clongleadbody: 特朗普与共和党高层在亚利桑那州为柯克举行追悼会，赞颂柯克的遗产与贡献。
eheadline: Charlie Kirk praised as conservative ‘martyr’ in mass memorial service
elongleadbody: Trump and senior Republicans mix faith and politics in Arizona commemoration that draws crowd in tens of thousands
tag: 美国政治,查理•柯克,唐纳德•特朗普,美国共和党,商业快报,会员专享
cbody:
唐纳德•特朗普(Donald Trump)称查理•柯克(Charlie Kirk)是保守主义的“传道者”和“殉道者”。10万名悼念者聚集在亚利桑那州，为这位活动人士举行追悼会。柯克遇刺事件在政治光谱两端都引起了巨大震荡。

上周日，特朗普、副总统JD•万斯(JD Vance)以及其内阁多名高级成员在菲尼克斯城郊的美式橄榄球场州立农场体育场(State Farm Stadium)向人群发表讲话。

追悼会持续了五个多小时，数十位美国共和党政治人物、保守派媒体人士和福音派领袖齐聚一堂，赞颂柯克的遗产与贡献。

“这位美国自由的布道者已成不朽，”特朗普在谈到本月早些时候遭枪杀、年仅31岁的柯克时说道，“他如今是美国自由的殉道者。”

上周日清晨，悼念者排起长队——有些人前一晚就露营等候——他们按活动主办方“美国转折点”(Turning Point USA)的要求，身着“红、白或蓝”的“周日最佳装束”。

许多人戴着红色的棒球帽和其他带有“特朗普”标识的物品。还有人身着胸前用黑色字母写着“自由”(freedom)的白色T恤——与柯克遇害时所穿的服装相同。

查理•柯克的妻子埃丽卡•柯克在丈夫的悼念会上登台

整个赛场俨然化身巨型教堂，悼念者起立，与现场演奏的基督教摇滚乐队一同歌唱。

“那个把查理从我们身边夺走的残忍凶手本以为我们今天会办葬礼，但我的朋友们，恰恰相反，我们迎来的是复兴。”万斯说。

“我现在看得很清楚，查理•柯克是位先知——不是那种算命先生……而是圣经中的先知。”美国转折点发言人安德鲁•科尔维特(Andrew Kolvet)说，“他直面邪恶，宣讲真理，呼唤我们悔改得救。”

但这场追悼仪式也无疑是一场政治事件。特朗普步入场馆时，人群高呼“U-S-A”。

坐在看台上的悼念者获发印有“永不屈服”(Never Surrender)和“这是我们的转折点”(This is Our Turning Point)等口号的海报。志愿者还分发了如何注册投票的资料。

在白宫派出两架满载工作人员的专机前往出席悼念会后，特朗普内阁的多位成员——包括国务卿马尔科•鲁比奥(Marco Rubio)、国防部长皮特•赫格塞思(Pete Hegseth)以及卫生与公众服务部长小罗伯特•F•肯尼迪(Robert F Kennedy Jr)——也向这位活动人士致敬。

美国总统唐纳德•特朗普：“他并不憎恨他的反对者，他希望他们更好。这一点上我与查理有分歧”

柯克创立了“美国转折点”，这是一个在高校与中学推广保守主义理念的草根力量。不到两周前，柯克在犹他州遇害身亡，原本那里是他大学校园巡回演讲的起点。

该团体的政治组织“转折点行动”(Turning Point Action)近年来被广泛认为在为特朗普及共和党凝聚支持方面功不可没，柯克被视为特朗普、万斯及其他高级官员的可信赖顾问。

该组织首席运营官泰勒•鲍耶(Tyler Bowyer)将这场追悼会比作一场特朗普集会。

“查理总是对我说：‘要是我们能想办法把圣灵带进一场特朗普集会就好了。’”鲍耶对台下的人说，“我想你做到了。”

鉴于有多位高级官员出席，美国特勤局(US Secret Service)以及州和地方执法部门在场馆周边部署了严密的安保措施。

周日晚的追悼会上，唐纳德•特朗普与埃隆•马斯克在防弹玻璃后握手。

今年早些时候与特朗普闹得不欢而散的科技亿万富翁埃隆•马斯克(Elon Musk)也出席了上周日的追悼活动。马斯克虽未向人群发表讲话，但他与总统在贵宾休息室内亲切交谈的画面曝光后，仍引发了关注。

柯克遇害之时，正值美国政治暴力加剧、党派分歧进一步加深。

特朗普和白宫多名高官将柯克之死归咎于“激进左翼”，并誓言通过追诉政治对手为其报仇，其中包括发表司法部长帕姆•邦迪(Pam Bondi)所称“仇恨言论”的人士。批评人士称，特朗普政府正将柯克遇害事件武器化，用来压制其批评者。

在上周日的追悼会上，特朗普首席政策顾问、曾多次呼吁联邦政府打击其反对者的斯蒂芬•米勒(Stephen Miller)再次以强硬口吻发声。

“风暴对战士低语：你无法承受我的力量。战士低声回应：我就是风暴。”米勒说。“我们就是风暴。我们的敌人无法理解我们的力量、决心、意志与激情。”

埃丽卡•柯克谈到刺杀她丈夫的凶手时说：“我原谅他。”

在社交媒体上拥有数百万粉丝的柯克是一位两极化人物，主张强硬的保守立场，并推崇一种基督教民族主义。

犹他州州政府当局以加重谋杀罪起诉22岁的泰勒•罗宾逊(Tyler Robinson)，并将寻求判处死刑。该案检察官称，枪手的动机来自柯克的“政治表达”。

查理•柯克的遗孀埃丽卡•柯克将接任“美国转折点”首席执行官，她在上周日含泪表示她愿意原谅杀害其丈夫的人。

“那个年轻人，我原谅他。我原谅他，因为这是基督会这样做，查理也会这样做。”

但作为上周日最后一位发言者，特朗普语气更不留情，他称枪手为“被激进化的冷血怪物”，并将政治暴力归咎于“另一方”。

“（查理•柯克）不憎恨他的反对者，他希望他们更好。这一点上我与查理有分歧，”特朗普说。“我憎恨我的反对者，也不希望他们变得更好。”
ebody:
Donald Trump praised Charlie Kirk as an “evangelist” and a “martyr” for conservatism as 100,000 mourners gathered in Arizona for a memorial service for the activist whose assassination sent shockwaves across the political divide.

Trump, vice-president JD Vance and senior members of his cabinet addressed the crowd at State Farm Stadium, an American football arena just outside of Phoenix, on Sunday.

The memorial service lasted for more than five hours, as dozens of Republican politicians, conservative media figures and evangelical leaders praised Kirk’s legacy.

“This evangelist for American liberty became immortal,” Trump said of Kirk, who was gunned down earlier this month at the age of 31. “He is a martyr now for American freedom.”

Mourners lined up in the early hours of Sunday morning — with some camping out the night before — dressed in “Sunday best” of “red, white or blue,” as requested by the event’s organisers, Turning Point USA.

Many wore red baseball caps and other Trump-branded items. Others arrived in white T-shirts with the word “freedom” written on the front in black letters — the same outfit Kirk was wearing when he was killed.

Erika Kirk, wife of Charlie Kirk, appears on stage during the memorial for her slain husband

The arena took on the feel of a megachurch, with mourners standing and singing along to live performances from Christian rock bands.

“The evil murderer who took Charlie from us expected us to have a funeral today, and instead, my friends, we have had a revival,” said Vance.

“I see it now, clearly, that Charlie Kirk was a prophet, not the fortune telling kind . . . but the biblical kind,” said Turning Point spokesman Andrew Kolvet. “He confronted evil and proclaimed the truth and called us to repent and be saved.”

But the memorial service was also undeniably a political event. The crowd broke out in cheers of “U-S-A” when Trump entered the arena.

Mourners in stadium seats were given posters with slogans including “Never Surrender” and “This is Our Turning Point”. Volunteers also handed out information about how to register to vote.

Several members of Trump’s cabinet — including secretary of state Marco Rubio, defence secretary Pete Hegseth and health and human services secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr — also paid tribute to the activist, after the White House sent two planes full of staffers to the memorial service.

US President Donald Trump: "He did not hate his opponents. He wanted the best for them. That's where I disagreed with Charlie"

Kirk founded Turning Point USA, a grassroots juggernaut that promotes conservative ideals at colleges, universities and secondary schools. He was shot dead less than two weeks ago in Utah at what was supposed to be the start of a tour of college campuses.

The group’s political arm, Turning Point Action, has been widely credited with rallying support for Trump and the Republican party in recent years, and Kirk was seen as a trusted adviser to the president, Vance and other senior officials.

Tyler Bowyer, the group’s chief operating officer, likened the memorial service to a Trump rally.

“[Charlie] always said to me: ‘If we could just figure out how to bring the Holy Spirit into a Trump rally’,” Bowyer told the crowd. “I think you’ve done it.”

The US Secret Service and state and local law enforcement put in place extensive security measures surrounding the arena given the number of high-ranking officials in attendance.

Donald Trump and Elon Musk, behind plate glass, shake hands during the memorial on Sunday evening

Elon Musk, the tech billionaire who fell out dramatically with Trump earlier this year, also attended Sunday’s memorial. While Musk did not address the crowds, he attracted attention when he shared what appeared to be a warm conversation with the president while the two men sat in a hospitality suite.

Kirk’s killing has come at a time of increased political violence and deepening partisan divides in the US.

Trump and many senior White House officials have blamed Kirk’s death on the “radical left” and vowed to avenge his killing by pursuing political opponents, including those who engage in what attorney-general Pam Bondi has described as “hate speech”. Critics have said the Trump administration is weaponising Kirk’s murder to silence their critics.

At Sunday’s memorial service, Stephen Miller, Trump’s top policy adviser who has repeatedly called for the federal government to go after its detractors, once again struck a strident tone.

“The storm whispers to the warrior that you cannot withstand my strength, and the warrior whispers back, I am the storm,” said Miller. “We are the storm, and our enemies cannot comprehend our strength, our determination, our resolve, our passion.”

Erika Kirk on husband's assassin: "I forgive him"

Kirk, who had millions of followers on social media, was a polarising figure, espousing hardline conservative positions and a brand of Christian nationalism.

State authorities in Utah have charged 22-year-old Tyler Robinson with aggravated murder, and will seek the death penalty. The prosecutor in the case said the shooter had been motivated by Kirk’s “political expression”.

Erika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s widow, who will take over as chief executive of Turning Point USA, said in a tearful speech on Sunday that she was willing to forgive her husband’s killer.

“That young man, I forgive him. I forgive him because it is what Christ did and it is what Charlie would do.”

But Trump, who was Sunday’s final speaker, was less conciliatory, calling the shooter a “radicalised, cold-blooded monster” and blaming the “other side” for political violence.

“[Charlie Kirk] didn’t hate his opponents, he wanted the best for them. That’s where I disagreed with Charlie,” Trump said. “I hate my opponent and I don’t want the best for them.”
